speaker: BLAKE
line: So, what do you think, man?

speaker: MICHAEL
line: What do I think about what?

speaker: BLAKE
line: That's the Brady Bunch house. That's "the" house - where they shot "The Brady Bunch."

speaker: MICHAEL
line: What are you on? Crack? Does that honestly look like "The Brady Bunch" house to you?

speaker: BLAKE
line: From inside it does. Straight up, dude. I was there delivering a pizza last night, and the guy who lives there is all, like, tryin' to crowd the door so I can't see inside. But then... he drops his Crazy Bread and bends down... and *boom!* I see it all, man! "The Brady Bunch" house. I'll prove it.

speaker: MICHAEL
line: No! Wait!

speaker: MICHAEL
line: What are you doing? Blake? It's midnight, man.

speaker: BLAKE
line: My honour's at stake, man.

speaker: MICHAEL
line: All right, nobody's home. Let's go. Come on.

speaker: BLAKE
line: It's not even locked.

speaker: MICHAEL
line: You're trippin', dude.

speaker: BLAKE
line: Huh? See? I told you.

speaker: BLAKE
line: This is exactly like the show. look at this! That weird horse sculpture and the vase that Peter broke. Mama always said, "Don't play ball in the house." You remember that one?.

speaker: MICHAEL
line: I don't understand this.

speaker: BLAKE
line: Who's on crack now, huh?

speaker: MICHAEL
line: Hello?

speaker: BLAKE
line: Remember the episode where Marcia broke her nose? She got hit with a football, right?

speaker: MICHAEL
line: Screw this, man. I'm outta here.

speaker: BLAKE
line: Daley, don't be a puss.

speaker: BLAKE
line: Daley?

speaker: BLAKE
line: H-Hello?

speaker: BLAKE
line: Bobby? Cindy?

speaker: BLAKE
line: Wait! Wait!

speaker: MICHAEL
line: Come on, man! Come on!

speaker: MICHAEL
line: Oh, my God...

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm tellin' ya.

speaker: REYES
line: No. I don't see how.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, how else do you explain it? A guy falls from a plane, or a... I don't know, maybe a helicopter. Out the door and then...... bam. Simple as that.

speaker: REYES
line: And how, exactly, did he wind up in a helicopter, when supposedly he was busy breaking into someone's house at the time?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Details.

speaker: REYES
line: What you got?.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Maybe nothin'.

speaker: MICHAEL
line: You the people from the FBI?

speaker: REYES
line: Michael Daley?

speaker: MICHAEL
line: Yeah. Is someone finally gonna arrest that freak?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, how about you tell us what you witnessed, and then we'll go from there.

speaker: MICHAEL
line: What I witnessed was Freaksville, man! My friend was murdered. Who would have thought this could happen at "The Brady Bunch" house.

speaker: REYES
line: That's not "The Brady Bunch" house.

speaker: MICHAEL
line: Yeah, it is. I mean, I know it doesn't look like it, but... but it is. That's where they shot the show.

speaker: REYES
line: No, they shot the show on a soundstage in Hollywood. The house they used for the exteriors is a split-level in Studio City. I took a picture of it once.

speaker: MICHAEL
line: I'm telling you, it's like some kind of creepy Brady Bunch museum in there. I told the cops to search the place, but they wouldn't listen to me. But whatever the hell happened to Blake, it happened right in there.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Oliver Martin?

speaker: REYES
line: Mr. Martin, I'm Agent Reyes. This is Agent Doggett. We're with the FBI.

speaker: OLIVER
line: This is regarding the death that happened across the street?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yes, Sir. May we come in?

speaker: OLIVER
line: I-I already talked to the police about this..

speaker: REYES
line: Yes, Sir, we know.

speaker: OLIVER
line: As I told them, I didn't see or hear anything. I wasn't home at the time.

speaker: MICHAEL
line: This guy's stonewalling. Kick the door in.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Shut up.

speaker: OLIVER
line: I'm... really kinda busy.

speaker: REYES
line: Mr. Martin, just five minutes and we'll be out of your hair.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Unless you want us to get a warrant, and then... we could be here for hours.

speaker: MICHAEL
line: Right in here, see?

speaker: MICHAEL
line: What happened? This isn't what I. saw. None of it. It's all different. Where'd it all go?

speaker: OLIVER
line: I'm... not following.

speaker: MICHAEL
line: What happened to all the Brady Bunch stuff?

speaker: REYES
line: Uh, Mr. Daley was under the impression that your house was used for the filming of "The Brady Bunch", the television show.

speaker: OLIVER
line: Well... it wasn't.

speaker: MICHAEL
line: I know what I saw.

speaker: REYES
line: What are you lookin' at?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I want to check somethin' out. .

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Ah-ha. Hold this, please?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Ah-ha.

speaker: REYES
line: Twice with the "ah-ha's."

speaker: DOGGETT
line: The roof's been patched. When I was inside, I knew I smelled fresh plaster.

speaker: REYES
line: So, are you gonna fill me in?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: A - Eyewitness places the deceased inside this house just prior to the time of his demise. B - We found a fragment of roofing shingle at the scene of the impact. It would seem it matches the discarded piece you now hold in your hand. C - There's a hole in the roof, recently patched, this big around. Connect A to B to C.

speaker: REYES
line: Much in the fashion of, say, Daffy Duck or Wiley Coyote, the deceased shot straight up through the roof, flew high into the air and landed on his buddy's car? You're serious?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: A to B to C. I gotta tell ya, I think I'm finally gettin' the hang of this job.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Case number 1-4- dash-3-0-8, Blake McCormick. A well nourished Caucasian male, 24-years-old. I will begin with my external examination. And here is a likely place to start.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ahhhh!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Help me out here, Agent Scully. Monica thinks I'm losin' my marbles. What can you tell us about what happened to this guy?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well for starters, Mr. McCormick was dead before he landed on the car. His skull was pulverized from a previous impact. And judging by the roofing material that I found in the wound, I'd say that Agent Doggett's theory holds water.

speaker: REYES
line: Well, like I asked Agent Doggett, how exactly can that be?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Electricity.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: How's that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Or maybe electricity is only a by-product. I'm... I'm not really sure. But... look, I had an odd experience today. And, uh, and it made me think to try something unusual. I borrowed an EEG machine, and I wired Mr. McCormick to it. And for the last few hours, he's been putting off a faint reading.

speaker: REYES
line: Are you saying he's alive?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. He's dead as a hammer. Uh... what I'm reading is some sort of residual electricity, like a... like a battery that's draining off its charge. It's fascinating. I mean, I've never seen anything quite like it.

speaker: REYES
line: But what does it mean?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, if Mulder were here, I'd, uh, imagine he'd talk about research linking electromagnetic fluctuations to levitation, poltergeist activity, ghost sightings...

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Ghosts and poltergeists? That's what Mulder would say?

speaker: SCULLY
line: At the end of the day, I wouldn't have any theory that was any better. And I don't now.

speaker: MICHAEL
line: Here's to you, buddy.

speaker: ALICE
line: Well folks, I made pork chops and apple sauce.

speaker: ALL
line: Oh!

speaker: MICHAEL
line: What is this, man? What in Holy freakin' hell is this, man?

speaker: OLIVER
line: Please... leave.

speaker: MICHAEL
line: They were here. I saw 'em! I saw 'em all!!

speaker: OLIVER
line: Leave... before it's too late.

speaker: MICHAEL
line: I saw the Brady Bunch.

speaker: MICHAEL
line: Oh, my God! What are you doing? Oh, my God. Oh, my God!

speaker: REPORTER
line: Over here, guys! Get the body in the background!

speaker: REYES
line: Smile. All of Southern California's watching us scratch our heads in confusion.

speaker: REPORTER
line: ... second time in one week, as this morning police were called to the house.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So let's go get some damn answers.

speaker: REPORTER
line: There they found the body of a young man. Although authorities have yet to release any information...

speaker: OLIVER
line: I've said all I'm gonna say to you people! You don't like it, go get your warrant!

speaker: REYES
line: He called your bluff. Maybe we can get a warrant.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah. Judge, I want to toss the house of a man who makes people magically zoom into the sky. It has somethin' to do with electricity and poltergeists and what not. Yeah, that'll fly.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Doggett.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So, the owner won't talk, huh?

speaker: REPORTER
line: There you see the two officials...

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Excuse me?

speaker: REPORTER
line: ... who we assume...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Smile. You're on TV.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Ah...

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm in Los Angeles at the Field Office. I've called in someone whom you'll both want to meet.

speaker: DR. REITS
line: April 4th, 1970, 10:36 AM. Present for this test are John Reits, speaking, and Anthony Fogelman, age 8. Hello, Anthony. Are you ready to begin? Good. Now, relax. Relax and focus. Almost immediately the EEG is registering an increase of fast beta wave activity on all leads. Theta activity is rising as well. Oh, my goodness. Oh! My goodness.

speaker: DR. REITS
line: Well, there you have it. My right hand to God, all four blocks rose off of the table, and spiralled halfway to the ceiling before they fell.

speaker: REYES
line: Too bad that wasn't on film.

speaker: DR. REITS
line: The understatement of a lifetime. Whatever phenomena caused this, I also believe that it radiated an electro-magnetic field strong enough to defog the image. Well, don't be polite. Call me crazy. Everybody does.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I believe you. Did you recognize that kid? That was our suspect, Oliver Martin. Right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I went through Mulder's reference books. Van Nuys, California, 1970, one of the best documented cases of what was initially thought to be poltergeist activity. It focused on a young. boy, Anthony Fogelman, who has since changed his name. And Doctor Reits was the parapsychologist who investigated it.

speaker: DR. REITS
line: Objects flew around the house. Rooms would grow inexplicably cold. Strange voices would be heard. Anthony's mother was at the end of her rope. I spent six months with her and her son. Six astonishing months.

speaker: REYES
line: What did you learn?

speaker: DR. REITS
line: That Anthony was as bewildered as everyone else. But that he was responsible for all of it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He was psychokinetic.

speaker: DR. REITS
line: He was the Mozart of psychokinesis.

speaker: REYES
line: Sir, in your line of work, why would you fall out of touch with the Mozart of psychokinesis?

speaker: DR. REITS
line: Over time, Anthony's abilities faded. The last few months I was with him, there were no manifestations of it whatsoever.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He lost his power?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: We're lookin' at this guy for two murders. What can you give us that we could actually take to a judge? Was he... Was he an angry kid? Was he violent?

speaker: DR. REITS
line: I can't say what he grew up to be. I... haven't spoken to him in 30 years. But the Anthony I knew... was a lonely little boy.

speaker: MARCIA
line: Bye!

speaker: JAN
line: Bye!.

speaker: DR. REITS
line: This is a message for Oliver Martin. Oliver? I believe I knew you years ago as Anthony. This is Dr. John Reits calling. Remember me? It's been far too long, and uh... I'd love... I'd love to talk to you. I'd really... like to catch up. Obviously, uh, you're all grown up now. It's funny. I have trouble picturing that. My God, how time flies. But, uh, anyway...

speaker: DR. REITS
line: ... you can reach me any time on my cell phone. 714-555-0146. I look forward to hearing from you. Bye now.

speaker: DR. REITS
line: I guess he's not home.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: He's home.

speaker: REYES
line: Ah- ha. I was wondering why a man with no criminal record would change his name. And then I thought about the name itself. Oliver Martin. It sounded familiar, so I ran it.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Through what, NCIC?

speaker: REYES
line: No. A Brady Bunch website. It popped right up.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Cousin Oliver. Who the hell's that?

speaker: REYES
line: Carol Brady's nephew. He came to live with the Brady's during the last season of the show.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You're speaking Greek to me here, uh... What's this case have to do with an old TV show?

speaker: REYES
line: You remember what Michael Daley claimed he saw inside that house? He said it was the Brady Bunch house. He seemed certain of it. And now this name, Oliver Martin? Just connecting A to B to C.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Does this make any sense to you? When you knew Anthony, was he nutty for the Brady Bunch?

speaker: DR. REITS
line: No. We'd watch it together.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Okay, say he is. What's it mean?

speaker: REYES
line: Well, why name himself after cousin Oliver? None of the other Brady's particularly liked Oliver. He was a self-described pest.

speaker: SCULLY
line: A jinx. Cousin Oliver, the Jinx. Oh, so maybe I watched an episode or two. Uh... so what you're saying is that, uh, his choice speaks to Anthony Fogelman's character. How he views himself. Um, unlucky, star-crossed, a danger.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Okay, so be it. Just tell me how this helps me bust him, and uh, I'm happy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I'm starting to hope that it doesn't come to that.

speaker: REYES
line: What do you mean?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, the power that this man seemingly possesses is extraordinary. It needs to be studied.

speaker: DR. REITS
line: It could expand the scope of human knowledge. It could change everything.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It very well could. I mean, I've... I've been working this unit for nine years now. I-I've investigated nearly 200 paranormal cases. We are due for some incontrovertible proof. I want vindication, for... for Mulder and... for all of us.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What in the hell?

speaker: DR. REITS
line: What is it? Agent Doggett, what?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Wait here.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Oliver Martin? FBI!

speaker: OLIVER
line: Get out of my house.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Oliver, there's someone here that wants to talk to you. Dr. Reits - you remember him?

speaker: OLIVER
line: Why won't you people just leave me alone? Please, get out..

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Oh, crap.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Oliver? Dr. Reits? I need some help up here. Oliver? You up there? Down there? Whatever the hell?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Oliver? Oliver?

speaker: DR. REITS
line: Anthony?.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Hey! Hey! I'm up here! Dr. Reits! Help me out here!

speaker: DR. REITS
line: Anthony?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Come back here, man! He's dangerous!

speaker: DR. REITS
line: Anthony?

speaker: DR. REITS
line: Anthony, let him go.

speaker: OLIVER
line: I can't.

speaker: DR. REITS
line: Sure you can.

speaker: OLIVER
line: No. I don't know how.

speaker: DR. REITS
line: Anthony, you're a good person. I know that hasn't changed. Relax, and focus, remember? Good. Relax... and focus.

speaker: REYES
line: Oh - my - God. This is... Are you all right?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Just minor bruising.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Dana Scully? Meet Oliver Martin.

speaker: DR. REITS
line: Uh... Anthony Fogelman.

speaker: OLIVER
line: Oliver.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oliver. It's a great pleasure to meet you.

speaker: REYES
line: Where did all this come from, Oliver? How did you make this come to be?

speaker: OLIVER
line: I think about it, and it's here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Can you think about other things? What happens if you think about another place? A nice place?

speaker: DR. REITS
line: Can you do that, Oliver? Please? It's important to me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, my god.

speaker: OLIVER
line: Mainly... I like to be here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oliver? With your help, we could learn so much. I would love to take you back with us to Washington.

speaker: DR. REITS
line: It would mean so much to me, Oliver, to show the whole world.

speaker: DR. REITS
line: Wonderful. Let's go get you packed.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: We've got a tiger by the tail.

speaker: REYES
line: Do you believe he intended to kill you?.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: He wanted me out of his house, and the way I went, it was involuntary like a sneeze. What the hell difference does it make? It means he's not in control of this power of his.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I think that's where we can help him. I mean, he needs to learn how to control his powers. I mean, my God. There's no end to what he could accomplish.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: And there's no end to the harm he could cause if he goes off the deep end, which isn't too long a walk for this guy, in case you haven't noticed. I mean, this whole Brady Bunch thing? I'm not so sure about this.

speaker: REYES
line: Well, we can't keep him here. Two people are dead. Clearly, this isn't working.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And besides, I mean... as grand as this may sound, we owe it to the world.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Maybe. Except that I can't shake this feelin' that the other shoe's gonna drop. That there's somethin' Oliver's not tellin' us.

speaker: DR. REITS
line: Oliver? You coming?

speaker: DR. REITS
line: Oliver?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Wow!

speaker: OLIVER
line: May I have a glass of water?

speaker: SKINNER
line: We'll only be a minute. Anything you need just, uh, ask Arlene.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So, what do you think, Dr. Jaycocks?

speaker: DR. JAYCOCKS
line: What do I think? I think there's a hell of a lot of physics books that are due for major rewrites.

speaker: DR. JAYCOCKS
line: And I think a year from now, you and Dr. Reits will be in Stockholm accepting the Nobel Prize. This will change everything. May I use your phone?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Yeah.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So, you're onboard with this?

speaker: REYES
line: What happens next?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I want Kersh to see this. I want the Director himself in here. I mean, do you realize what this means? This kind of proof? It ensures that they can't shut you down. It means the X-Files will go on forever.

speaker: ARLENE
line: Oh!

speaker: ARLENE
line: Agent Scully?!!

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's having a seizure. What happened?

speaker: ARLENE
line: I saw a big spark, and then he just collapsed.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: We need an ambulance. We got a man havin' a seizure. Fourth floor, AD Skinner's office. Make it quick.

speaker: DR. REITS
line: It was just all the excitement. A little bed rest will do him wonders, and we'll get things right back on schedule.

speaker: REYES
line: What do his doctors say?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oliver's electrolytes were severely imbalanced. That's what sent him into shock. They've stabilized his fluids.

speaker: DR. REITS
line: Well, when will they release him?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, there's other problems. His thyroid level is elevated, his glucose is low, CPK liver enzymes and BUN, they're all elevated.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Which in a nutshell means?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It points to a multi-system organ failure. Gradually, his body is consuming itself. It's been going on for months, and... maybe even years.

speaker: REYES
line: Well, what's causing it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: His doctors have no idea, but I think I'm starting to.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: This power of his, it's eating him alive.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And if so, it follows that the more he uses it, the more his health will decline... until finally...

speaker: REYES
line: What in the hell?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, my God.

speaker: DR. REITS
line: Oliver?

speaker: REYES
line: Oliver, those people just now? Was that... Were they...?.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Why were they here?

speaker: OLIVER
line: To say goodbye.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why goodbye, Oliver?

speaker: OLIVER
line: Because I'm dying.

speaker: DR. REITS
line: April 4th, 1970, 10:36 AM. Present for this test are John Reits, speaking, and Anthony Fogelman, age 8. Hello, Anthony. Are you ready to begin?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Any change in his condition?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, they're trying everything they can think of. Experimental drugs, plasma transfusion.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: None of that's gonna work.

speaker: DR. REITS
line: Why not?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Because they're treatin' the symptoms, not the cause.

speaker: REYES
line: What do you have, John?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: One big question. Why "The Brady Bunch"? Seriously, you two are fans. Why are people still watchin' a 30 year old TV show?

speaker: REYES
line: Because... they're the family everyone wishes they had. Loving parents, lots of brothers and sisters, everybody getting along.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They're the, uh, perfect family. And since Oliver didn't have one as a child, he... created one.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Sure, I'd buy all that. But in this case, why "The Brady Bunch"? Why not "The Partridge Family"? Why not "Eight Is Enough"? Where was Oliver when you first saw "The Brady Bunch"? He was with you, right?

speaker: DR. REITS
line: He'd always insisted we watch it together, every week I was there.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: And the longer you two were together, the more his psychokinetic power faded, until finally it went away completely. Now, what do you think that was?

speaker: DR. REITS
line: Because for the first time in his life, he was happy.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Because he was with you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, what are you suggesting is the course of action, John?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: A - Oliver's gonna die if he continues to use his power. B - his power goes away when he's happy. And C - you're the father he never had, and he loves you. A to B to C.

speaker: ORDERLY
line: Come on, Oliver. You gotta eat somethin', man. Doctor's orders.

speaker: ORDERLY
line: Talk to him, will ya?

speaker: DR. REITS
line: Oliver? You have to understand. My life's work... the vindication of it, it's so important to me. I let it blind me. I treated you like... a lab rat, and not a man. And 30 years ago, I left, with barely a goodbye. I am sorry for that. You can't use your power. Not ever again. I forbid it.

speaker: OLIVER
line: I can't be alone.

speaker: DR. REITS
line: You won't be. You've got me. Can you forgive me, Oliver?

speaker: OLIVER
line: Anthony.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So close, Dana. I'm sorry you don't get your proof.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Me too. Well, maybe I've had it these past nine years. If not proof of the paranormal, then... of more important things.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, here's hopin' the TV stays off and he learns how to love the real world.

speaker: REYES
line: I think you are getting the hang of this job.
